byline.original: Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

abstract: Berlin Foreign Office press believes Balkans will adhere to peace policy despite Allied-Turkish attempts to seek disturbances; Italy feels confident Yugoslavia will guard neutrality and status quo policies; Hungary expects conf failure
snippet: BERLIN, Feb. 2--All indications are that the Balkan countries do not wish to embark on any new course, the end of which would be unpredictable, writes the Diplomatisch-Politische Korrespondenz on the occasion of the Balkan Entente meeting....

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: MEDITERRANEAN, AFRICA AND NEAR EAST AREAS

headline.main: NAZIS SEE BALKANS ADHERING TO PEACE; Nations Are Held Unlikely to Embark on a New Policy at This Time, Press Contends ITALY IS ALSO CONFIDENT Feels Sure Yugoslavia Will Guard Interests--Hungary Expects Parley Failure

lead_paragraph: BERLIN, Feb. 2--All indications are that the Balkan countries do not wish to embark on any new course, the end of which would be unpredictable, writes the Diplomatisch-Politische Korrespondenz on the occasion of the Balkan Entente meeting.
